content.question: If <math alttext="the integral from, 1 to 4, of, f of x, d x, equals 8" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>8</mn></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math> and <math alttext="the integral from, 1 to 4, of, g of x, d x, equals negative 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>, which of the following cannot be determined from the information given?

choices.label: <math alttext="the integral from, 4 to 1, of, g of x, d x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msubsup><mo>∫</mo><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

<math alttext="the integral from, 1 to 4, of, 3 times f of x, d x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

<math alttext="the integral from, 1 to 4, of, 3 times f of x, times g of x, d x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msubsup><mo>∫</mo><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

<math alttext="the integral from, 1 to 4, of, open parenthesis, 3 times f of x, plus g of x, close parenthesis, d x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msubsup><mo>∫</mo><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>+</mo><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the integral from, 1 to 4, of, 3 times f of x, times g of x, d x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msubsup><mo>∫</mo><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the classification of a given expression (e.g., Use the chain rule to find the derivative of a composite function).
